intro: Leptodermis hechiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Guangxi region. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
